utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, yes I just came in today because I've been a bit concerned about some breathing difficulties over the last few days. It all started out with like a cough over the last week, but now I'm having trouble breathing as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh OK, well I'm sorry to hear that. So you said a cough as well, so the cough at least a week back and the shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So yeah, the cough, I usually have a cough. I've had COPD for a long time, but this past week the coughing has been much worse with a lot of more sputum and. Other than that, it started I would say two to three days ago. The cough got worse and then every time I'm moving around I like have to sit down and catch my breath, which is pretty abnormal for me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, so alright. So let's focus on the cough first. You said it's a wet cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I am producing a lot of sputum.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what color is your sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's mainly like clear white.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah so you don't see yellow pus or anything green or bloody in there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so. But there's definitely like a lot more than what I usually produce.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, umm this cough, does it sound harsh, barky or does it sound muffled?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say it's a bit harsh at times. I wouldn't say it's barky or muffled. I do find myself wheezing a little over the last few days as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you find you have any chest pain associated with the shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, I don't really have any pains.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you ever experienced anything like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did a couple of years ago, I had to be admitted because I had some shortness of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But that was, I think, two years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And when you were admitted two years ago, did they tell you what you had?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they said I had some kind of lung infection at that time, so they gave me some antibiotics while I was in the hospital.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did they ever say to you that you had anything else like asthma, COPD, any longstanding conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah so I've had COPD for more than... I guess more than 10 years now so I think it just got a lot worse with the infection.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah alright. So this time around, have you had any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been having a couple of chills but like they would come and go. I didn't really think it was a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about changes in your hair or nails like or or skin like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how about smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no. I think they're the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have a stuffy nose or runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do feel a bit stuffy, but it's not too bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any swelling in your in your legs or upper limbs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about calf pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Memory loss or confusion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your bowel movement or abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes to urinating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's all fine

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so besides the COPD, do you have any other longstanding conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do have some high blood pressure which I take, I think I take one of these medications called metoprolol.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when was the last time you had your blood pressure checked?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, probably like a month ago and it was pretty good. I've been checking by myself at home too and it hasn't been changing too much. I think the last one I took was probably like 135 / 80.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I see. OK, any hospitalizations besides the one that you had for COPD a year back?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, back when I was a kid I had my tonsils removed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you on any medications besides the metoprolol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do take multivitamins.I think that's yeah, that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you take any puffers for your COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I do have three like different puffers I take. I can't remember the name. I do have some puffers I don't take. I've been using them right now. It has been helping with some of my shortness of breath, but I've definitely been having to use them way more than I used to.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you know which puffer you're on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I think one of them is called ventolin. OK, and then I think the second one is called the Spiriva.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sure, Yep.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So one of them should be a short acting beta agonist.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Just wanna make sure that you have one with a long acting and then the other one is a long acting beta agonist. OK, good. Alright, are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And are you allergic to anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any family history of lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no I don't think so. Yeah, no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my father died of a heart attack in his 60s.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My uncle had skin cancer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you know what type of skin cancer like melanoma, basal cell, squamous cell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I think it wasn't the bad one. It was like the one they can remove right away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh I see. OK, OK, that's good.Do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been smoking for around, I would say the last 20 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how much do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably I would say pack a day for the last 20 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Umm, have you ever thought about quitting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I did. I did once and then went back onto it. I definitely do smoke less than before though. OK, but yeah, I don't think I'm ready to quit yet.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah no problem. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, yeah, maybe once a week I would have a small Cup of whiskey.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sure, that's fine. And any other drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no marijuana, no other drugs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right now I live in a small bungalow in London.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any reasons to believe there are carpets, dust, mold, asbestos, anything that could be triggering your COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, I don't think so. Everything is pretty up to date.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any contact with anyone that's been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been mostly trying to isolate and like just be in my own home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about travel to anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, I've been in Ontario since the beginning of the pandemic.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah OK, that makes sense. Well, those were all the questions that I had for you today. Did you have any questions of your own?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I was just worried if it can be COVID or if it's just like another infection that I had like before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so we're definitely going to do a COVID swab on you and those results should take about 24 to 48 hours to come back to you. And in the meantime, because your symptoms do overlap with COVID, you should isolate for 14 days. Public health will be in touch with you if it's positive to do some contact tracing. If it's not COVID, it could be another viral infection that's been going around during this time of year which is likely because you have COPD, since you're already coughing more than you usually are and seeing more sputum. We will reassess to see whether your puffers are working. If we need to add any additional things like inhaled corticosteroids as well as antibiotics and so just keep an eye on your symptoms for now and will also want to do probably a chest X Ray and possibly a pulmonary function test. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
